title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ando@maslab.aitech.ac.jp. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {jpaccidents: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan},   author = {Keisuke ANDO},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://nononoexe.github.io/jpaccidents/}, }

what: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: jpaccidents package handling traffic accident data Japan. package covers traffic accident data provided National Police Agency Japan. jpaccidentsは日本の交通事故のデータを扱うためのパッケージです。 このパッケージでは、警察庁が提供する交通事故データを対象としています。

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: can install development version jpaccidents like : jpaccidentsの開発版は以下のコマンドからインストールできます。

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: Load package follows: パッケージを以下のようにして読み込みます。 traffic accident data can used follows: 交通事故のデータは次のようにして利用することができます。 three types traffic accident data: main (honhyo), sub (hojyuhyo), highway (kosokuhyo) data. package provides functions . Use function appropriate data need. See also ? download_accident_main_data information. 交通事故のデータは本票、補充票、高速票の3種類があります。 それぞれに対応する関数が用意されています。 必要なデータに応じて利用してください。 詳しくは? download_accident_main_dataを参照してください。
code: library(jpaccidents) downloaded_path <- download_accident_main_data(download_dir = "download-dir-path", year = 2022) main_data <- read_accident_main_data(downloaded_path)

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: project licensed Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. このプロジェクトはクリエイティブ・コモンズ 表示 4.0 国際 ライセンスに従います。

title: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan
text: Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project agree abide terms. このプロジェクトは行動規範を設けています。 したがって、このプロジェクトでは参加者にこの行動規範に従うことを求めます。

what: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
text: function converts DMS (degree-minute-second) decimal degrees. input DMS values must format "DDDMMSSsss" : D: Degrees (1–3 digits) M: Minutes (2 digits) S: Seconds (2 digits) s: Milliseconds (3 digits)

title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
text: dms numeric vector DMS values format "DDDMMSSsss"

title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg
text: numeric vector decimal degrees.

title: Convert DMS (degree-minute-second) to decimal degrees — convert_deg

what: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: Download file traffic accident data provided National Police Agency's Web page (https://www.npa.go.jp/publications/statistics/koutsuu/opendata/index_opendata.html).

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: type Type data download: one "main", "sub", "highway". download_dir directory downloaded file saved (default: getwd()). year Year traffic accident data recorded. Available 2019 2023 (default: 2023).

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: Path downloaded file (invisibly).

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data
text: traffic accident data divided following types: "main" (honhyo) "sub" (hojuhyo) "highway" (kosokuhyo) can specify type data directly via type argument.

title: Download the traffic accident data — download_accident_data

what: jpaccidents: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan — jpaccidents-package
title: jpaccidents: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan — jpaccidents-package
text: package (one paragraph).

title: jpaccidents: Tools for Traffic Accident Data in Japan — jpaccidents-package
text: Maintainer: Keisuke ANDO ando@maslab.aitech.ac.jp

what: Read the traffic accident data — read_accident_data
title: Read the traffic accident data — read_accident_data
text: Read file traffic accident data. Use appropriate function type data want read: read_accident_main_data() read main data (honhyo). read_accident_sub_data() read sub data (hojuhyo). read_accident_highway_data() read highway data (kosokuhyo).

title: Read the traffic accident data — read_accident_data
Read the traffic accident data — read_accident_data
text: file character string file path.

title: Read the traffic accident data — read_accident_data
text: read_accident_main_data() separates traffic accident data injured party data target data returns list. read_accident_sub_data() read_accident_highway_data() return contents target data tibble.

title: Read the traffic accident data — read_accident_data
